sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
Partiallys updates an installation using the JSON-Patch.

Inputs :

  • Namespace - Name of the namespace.
  • Notification Hub - Name of the notification hub.
  • Installation ID - Unique ID of the installation.
  • Operation - Operation like add, remove or replace are used to update the installation.
  • Path - Path of the respective property to be updated.
  • Value - Value of the respective property to be updated.

Outputs :

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully, Status is set to “Success”. If there is a failure in Microsoft Azure Notification Hub, Status is set to “Error”.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages :

  • Invalid request body. The settings couldn't be read because the request was malformed (or the validation failed).
  • Authorization failure. The access key was incorrect.
  • Quota exceeded.
  • Namespace or Notification Hub or ID Not found.

To use this action, the corresponding Microsoft Azure Notification Hub connection and credential must be created and associated with the Microsoft Azure Notification Hub Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

publictruefalse305742c6db6d14106ad79e7aca961939e4aa8950dbe3c010c53e57a0cf961984Create or Overwrite an installat<p id = "short_desc"> Partiallys updates an installation using the JSON-Patch.</p><p><b>Inputs</b> :</p> <ul id = "inputs"><li><b>Namespace</b> - Name of the namespace.</li><li><b>Notification Hub</b> - Name of the notification hub.</li><li><b>Installation ID</b> - Unique ID of the installation.</li><li><b>Operation</b> - Operation like add, remove or replace are used to update the installation.</li><li><b>Path</b> - Path of the respective property to be updated.</li><li><b>Value</b> - Value of the respective property to be updated.</li><p></p></ul> <p><b>Outputs</b> : </p><ul id ='outputs'><li><b>Status</b> - If the request is executed successfully, Status is set to “Success”. If there is a failure in Microsoft Azure Notification Hub, Status is set to “Error”.</li><li><b>Error Message</b> - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Error Messages</b> : </p><ul id = 'error_messages'><li>Invalid request body. The settings couldn't be read because the request was malformed (or the validation failed).</li><li>Authorization failure. The access key was incorrect.</li><li>Quota exceeded.</li><li>Namespace or Notification Hub or ID Not found.</li></ul><p></p><p>To use this action, the corresponding Microsoft Azure Notification Hub connection and credential must be created and associated with the Microsoft Azure Notification Hub Connection & Credential alias. <a target='_blank' href='http://docs.servicenow.com/?context=CSHelp:credentials-connections-alias'>Learn More</a></p> <p></p> <p><b>Note</b>: Requires a subscription for production use. <a target='_blank'
